member.name: T:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanHandler
member.summary: IScanHandler is defined by the plugin to handle events during scanning.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanHandler.OnScanBegin(Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner,Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanBeginEventArgs)
member.summary: Called right before scanning begins.
member.remarks: Allows plugins to "override" the settings used by the scanner.
member.param: The scanner that is beginning scanning
The event arguments (nothing)

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanHandler.OnPageScan(Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner,Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.PageScanEventArgs)
member.summary: Method for handling the result of a page scan.
member.remarks:
When scanning PDF files, a OnPageScan event is raised per page with no file data, and at the end another OnPageScan event is raised with the PDF file data (but no actual page). When scanning other types of files, a single OnPageScan event is raised per page with file data.
When scanning from flatbed, OnPageScan could be called multiple times if auto crop or multi crop is enabled, each event having the corresponding cropped page.
member.param: The that invoked the event
Contains page scanning info

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanHandler.OnScanFinish(Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner,Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanFinishEventArgs)
member.summary: Method for handling scan session finish.
member.remarks: When scanning from ADF, this is raised when there are no more pages in the tray. When scanning from flatbed, this is raised once the documents on the flatbed were scanned.
member.param: The that invoked the event
The scan finish info

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanHandler.OnScanError(Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner,Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanErrorEventArgs)
member.summary: Method for handling errors during scanning.
member.remarks: This event can be raised in two circumstances, first, if an error occurred during scanning (e.g. paper jam), and also in the case when a user exception was thrown in either the OnPageScan or OnScanFinish events.
member.param: The that invoked the event
Scan error info

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.UI.StandardPages.CreateScanOptionsPage
member.summary: Creates a new scan options page to configure the scanner.
member.remarks: Plugins can open this page to allow the user to configure the scanner by the standard user interface provided by the KV-SS1100 software. Plugins can register an event handler to handle the page function's return event, to start their own scanning page or use a custom scanning page. NOTE: The registered Return event handler MUST be an instance method on the parent page's class!
member.returns: A new scan options page.

member.name: T:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.UI.UIManager
member.summary: The UI manager is used to gain access to the global navigation service as well as show dialogs on the user interface.
member.remarks: Use to enqueue commands to run on the UI thread.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.UI.UIManager.ShowMessageDialog(System.String,System.String,System.Windows.MessageBoxImage,System.Windows.MessageBoxButton,System.EventHandler{Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.UI.DialogResultEventArgs})
member.summary: Displays a message dialog.
member.remarks:
Similar to MessageBox.Show(). This will create a dialog with the given message and icon. The event handler can be used to receive a notification when the dialog has been closed. If another dialog is shown (another invocation of this call), then the old dialog will be hidden and replaced with the new dialog. Once the user confirms the new dialog, the old dialog shall be shown again.
NOTE: This method must be executed on the UI thread! Use the to enqueue UI commands.
member.param: The message to display
The title of the dialog
The icon to use, can be null if no icon is desired
The buttons to make available on the dialog
The event handler to be notified when the dialog is closed, can be null

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.UI.UIManager.ShowMessageDialog(System.String,System.Windows.MessageBoxImage,System.EventHandler{Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.UI.DialogResultEventArgs})
member.summary: Displays a message dialog.
member.remarks:
Similar to MessageBox.Show(). This will create a dialog with the given message and icon. The event handler can be used to receive a notification when the dialog has been closed. If another dialog is shown (another invocation of this call), then the old dialog will be hidden and replaced with the new dialog. Once the user confirms the new dialog, the old dialog shall be shown again.
NOTE: This method must be executed on the UI thread! Use the to enqueue UI commands.
member.param: The message to display
The icon to use, can be null if no icon is desired
The event handler to be notified when the dialog is closed, can be null

The title of the dialog
Callback to invoke when 'cancel' is pressed

member.remarks:
A dialog will be displayed with a pulsing progress bar, indicating an operation in progress that will take some time to complete.
NOTE: This method must be executed on the UI thread! Use the to enqueue UI commands.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.UI.UIManager.ShowProgressDialogForWorker(System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a progress dialog for a worker.
member.remarks: If the worker completes within 0.5 sec, then no dialog is shown. Otherwise, the dialog will be shown after the worker has been busy for 0.5 sec. The dialog will have a cancel button if the property is set to true. If the cancel button is pressed, then the worker will be cancelled.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.UI.UIManager.ShowDialog(System.Windows.Controls.Page)
member.summary: Displays a user defined dialog.
member.remarks:
The user dialog page is overlayed on top of the existing user interface.
NOTE: This method must be executed on the UI thread! Use the to enqueue UI commands.
member.param: The user defined dialog page

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.UI.UIManager.HideDialog
member.summary: Hides the currently visible dialog.
member.remarks: If a dialog was shown previously, it is hidden, causing the next dialog in the stack to be shown. When no more dialogs are in the stack, the window contents are displayed.

member.name: T:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.WebConfig.WebConfigServer
member.summary: Utility class for interfacing with the embedded web server.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.WebConfig.WebConfigServer.RegisterHttpHandler(System.String,System.String,Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.WebConfig.IHttpHandler)
member.summary: Registers an http handler to handle requests on the given prefix and also adds the configuration page on the server's index page.
member.remarks: First, the given handler is registered to receive requests at the given prefix. For example if the prefix is /MyPluginConfig, then all URLs matching that prefix shall be handled by the given handler. This includes URLs under that prefix such as /MyPluginConfig?ABC=XYZ or /MyPluginConfig/MyPage.html . Second, the prefix is added as a link on the main page of the web configuration server. The IT admin will be able to click the handler's name on the main page to browse to that configuration page.
member.param: The user friendly name of the handler or configuration page. This is the name displayed on the server's main page.
The URL prefix that this handler is going to handle
The handler to register
member.exception: When trying to register against the "/" prefix (not allowed)

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.WebConfig.WebConfigServer.UnregisterHttpHandler(System.String)
member.summary: Unregisters a previously registered handler.
member.param: The prefix to unregister
member.exception: When trying to unregister the "/" prefix (not allowed)

The string to send (will be encoded as UTF8)
The content type of the string. Generally "text/html" for HTML or "text/plain" for plain text

The image to send. It will be sent as a PNG image.

The HTML code that will be inserted into the head tag
The HTML code that will be inserted into the form tag inside the body

member.value: true if keyboard needs to be shown only on actuall device, otherwise false.

member.name: T:TouchScan.Keyboard.Controls.TextSelectionHandlers
member.summary: Utility class to implement various TextBox customizations.
member.remarks:
When a text box is registered, focusing on it will cause the entire text to be selected for easy deletion.
In addition, a workaround is implemented for a bug caused when ScrollViewer's style is changed by the app.
This is part of the behavior for software keyboard.

member.summary: Contains information about an available wireless network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.profileName
member.summary: Contains the profile name associated with the network. If the network doesn't have a profile, this member will be empty. If multiple profiles are associated with the network, there will be multiple entries with the same SSID in the visible network list. Profile names are case-sensitive.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.dot11Ssid
member.summary: Contains the SSID of the visible wireless network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.dot11BssType
member.summary: Specifies whether the network is an infrastructure or an ad-hoc one.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.numberOfBssids
member.summary: Indicates the number of BSSIDs in the network.

member.summary: Indicates whether the network is connectable.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.wlanNotConnectableReason
member.summary: Indicates why a network cannot be connected to. This member is only valid when is false.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.numberOfPhyTypes
member.summary: The number of PHY types supported on available networks. The maximum value of this field is 8. If more than 8 PHY types are supported, must be set to true.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.dot11PhyTypes
member.summary: Contains an array of values that represent the PHY types supported by the available networks. When is greater than 8, this array contains only the first 8 PHY types.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.morePhyTypes
member.summary: Specifies if there are more than 8 PHY types supported. When this member is set to true, an application must call to get the complete list of PHY types. contains the PHY type for an entry.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.wlanSignalQuality
member.summary: A percentage value that represents the signal quality of the network. This field contains a value between 0 and 100. A value of 0 implies an actual RSSI signal strength of -100 dbm. A value of 100 implies an actual RSSI signal strength of -50 dbm. You can calculate the RSSI signal strength value for values between 1 and 99 using linear interpolation.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAvailableNetwork.securityEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether security is enabled on the network.

member.summary: Indicates the default cipher algorithm to be used when joining this network.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags
member.summary: Defines flags which affect connecting to a WLAN network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.HiddenNetwork
member.summary:
Connect to the destination network even if the destination is a hidden network. A hidden network does not broadcast its SSID. Do not use this flag if the destination network is an ad-hoc network.
If the profile specified by is not null, then this flag is ignored and the nonBroadcast profile element determines whether to connect to a hidden network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.AdhocJoinOnly
member.summary: Do not form an ad-hoc network. Only join an ad-hoc network if the network already exists. Do not use this flag if the destination network is an infrastructure network.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.IgnorePrivacyBit
member.summary: Ignore the privacy bit when connecting to the network. Ignoring the privacy bit has the effect of ignoring whether packets are encryption and ignoring the method of encryption used. Only use this flag when connecting to an infrastructure network using a temporary profile.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionFlags.EapolPassthrough
member.summary: Exempt EAPOL traffic from encryption and decryption. This flag is used when an application must send EAPOL traffic over an infrastructure network that uses Open authentication and WEP encryption. This flag must not be used to connect to networks that require 802.1X authentication. This flag is only valid when is set to . Avoid using this flag whenever possible.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanConnectionParameters

member.remarks: Corresponds to the native WLAN_CONNECTION_PARAMETERS type.

member.summary: Specifies the mode of connection.

member.summary:
Specifies the profile being used for the connection. The contents of the field depend on the :
Value of Contents of the profile string
The name of the profile used for the connection.
The XML representation of the profile used for the connection.
, or null

member.summary: Gets an array of supported data transfer rates. If the rate is a basic rate, the first bit of the rate value is set to 1. A basic rate is the data transfer rate that all stations in a basic service set (BSS) can use to receive frames from the wireless medium.

member.summary: Matching security capabilities of Secondary IE in M3 failed (RSN)

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanReasonCode.MSMSEC_G1_MISSING_GRP_KEY

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanAssociationAttributes.wlanSignalQuality
member.summary: A percentage value that represents the signal quality of the network. This field contains a value between 0 and 100. A value of 0 implies an actual RSSI signal strength of -100 dbm. A value of 100 implies an actual RSSI signal strength of -50 dbm. You can calculate the RSSI signal strength value for values between 1 and 99 using linear interpolation.

member.summary: The transmission rate of the association.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm
member.summary: Defines a wireless LAN authentication algorithm.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native DOT11_AUTH_ALGORITHM type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IEEE80211_Open
member.summary: Specifies an IEEE 802.11 Open System authentication algorithm.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IEEE80211_SharedKey
member.summary: Specifies an 802.11 Shared Key authentication algorithm that requires the use of a pre-shared Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) key for the 802.11 authentication.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.WPA
member.summary:
Specifies a Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) algorithm. IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant, authenticator, and authentication server. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through the authentication process.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the WPA algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 1 (802.1X) within the WPA information element (IE).

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.WPA_PSK
member.summary:
Specifies a WPA algorithm that uses preshared keys (PSK). IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant and authenticator. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through a preshared key that is used on both the supplicant and authenticator.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the WPA PSK algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 2 (preshared key) within the WPA IE.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.WPA_None
member.summary: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.RSNA
member.summary:
Specifies an 802.11i Robust Security Network Association (RSNA) algorithm. WPA2 is one such algorithm. IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant, authenticator, and authentication server. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through the authentication process.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the RSNA algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 1 (802.1X) within the RSN IE.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.RSNA_PSK
member.summary:
Specifies an 802.11i RSNA algorithm that uses PSK. IEEE 802.1X port authentication is performed by the supplicant and authenticator. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through a preshared key that is used on both the supplicant and authenticator.
This algorithm is valid only for BSS types of .
When the RSNA PSK algorithm is enabled, the 802.11 station will associate only with an access point whose beacon or probe responses contain the authentication suite of type 2(preshared key) within the RSN IE.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IHV_Start
member.summary: Indicates the start of the range that specifies proprietary authentication algorithms that are developed by an IHV.
member.remarks: This enumerator is valid only when the miniport driver is operating in Extensible Station (ExtSTA) mode.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11AuthAlgorithm.IHV_End
member.summary: Indicates the end of the range that specifies proprietary authentication algorithms that are developed by an IHV.
member.remarks: This enumerator is valid only when the miniport driver is operating in Extensible Station (ExtSTA) mode.

member.name: T:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm
member.summary: Defines a cipher algorithm for data encryption and decryption.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the native DOT11_CIPHER_ALGORITHM type.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.None
member.summary: Specifies that no cipher algorithm is enabled or supported.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WEP40
member.summary: Specifies a Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) algorithm, which is the RC4-based algorithm that is specified in the 802.11-1999 standard. This enumerator specifies the WEP cipher algorithm with a 40-bit cipher key.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.TKIP
member.summary: Specifies a Temporal Key Integrity Protocol (TKIP) algorithm, which is the RC4-based cipher suite that is based on the algorithms that are defined in the WPA specification and IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard. This cipher also uses the Michael Message Integrity Code (MIC) algorithm for forgery protection.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.CCMP
member.summary: Specifies an AES-CCMP algorithm, as specified in the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard and RFC 3610. Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) is the encryption algorithm defined in FIPS PUB 197.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WEP104
member.summary: Specifies a WEP cipher algorithm with a 104-bit cipher key.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WPA_UseGroup
member.summary: Specifies a Robust Security Network (RSN) Use Group Key cipher suite. For more information about the Use Group Key cipher suite, refer to Clause 7.3.2.9.1 of the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.RSN_UseGroup
member.summary: Specifies a Wifi Protected Access (WPA) Use Group Key cipher suite. For more information about the Use Group Key cipher suite, refer to Clause 7.3.2.9.1 of the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.WEP
member.summary: Specifies a WEP cipher algorithm with a cipher key of any length.

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.IHV_Start
member.summary: Specifies the start of the range that is used to define proprietary cipher algorithms that are developed by an independent hardware vendor (IHV).

member.name: F:NativeWifi.Wlan.Dot11CipherAlgorithm.IHV_End
member.summary: Specifies the end of the range that is used to define proprietary cipher algorithms that are developed by an IHV.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.DeleteProfile(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a profile.
member.param: The name of the profile to be deleted. Profile names are case-sensitive. On Windows XP SP2, the supplied name must match the profile name derived automatically from the SSID of the network. For an infrastructure network profile, the SSID must be supplied for the profile name. For an ad hoc network profile, the supplied name must be the SSID of the ad hoc network followed by -adhoc.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.SetProfile(NativeWifi.Wlan.WlanProfileFlags,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the profile.
member.param: The flags to set on the profile.
The XML representation of the profile. On Windows XP SP 2, special care should be taken to adhere to its limitations.
If a profile by the given name already exists, then specifies whether to overwrite it (if true) or return an error (if false).
member.returns: The resulting code indicating a success or the reason why the profile wasn't valid.

member.name: M:NativeWifi.WlanClient.WlanInterface.GetProfileXml(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the profile's XML specification.
member.param: The name of the profile.
member.returns: The XML document.

member.returns: The profiles information.

member.name: M:TouchScan.RamDisk.RamDiskManager.LoadDriverAndService
member.summary: Loads the driver and helper service, then checks to make sure they are compatible with the IMDISK library used by the software.
member.exception: Thrown if the versions of the helper service and library are incompatible
Thrown if either the driver or service do not exist or cannot be loaded

member.name: M:TouchScan.RamDisk.RamDiskManager.CreateRamDisk(System.String,System.Char,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates a new RAMDISK virtual disk.
member.remarks:
The RAMDISK will have the following flags:
1) Virtual memory type (VM)
2) Removable
3) Hard drive
The filesystem header MUST match the size specified here otherwise the possibility of accessing corrupt memory could occur.
member.param: The image to load onto the disk. If smaller than size, then the image shall be loaded into the header of the disk and it will be expanded to match the size.
The drive letter to map onto the new disk
The size of the ramdisk to create.

member.summary: Account handler that searches list of recent emails that the current user sent emails to.

member.name: T:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.IAccountHandler
member.summary: Account handlers are used to search an address book or a directory system for accounts to send emails to.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.IAccountHandler.SearchAsync(System.String,Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.ISearchResultReceiver,System.Int32,System.Int32,Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.AccountSearchType)
member.summary: Executes an asynchronous search against the account handler to find accounts matching the query string.
member.remarks: The search should match query string parts against substrings in the account information (non case sensitive). For example, the query string "bert do" would match "Robert Doe (rdoe@example.com) since "bert" is a substring of "Robert" and "do" is a substring of "Doe".
member.param: The query string to search for, each part is separated by whitespace.
The delegate to receive the search results as they come in. Cannot be null.
The maximum number of results that the given search result receiver will receive.
If the server search takes longer than this to execute, then the search returns with the results found so far.
The type of accounts to return in the search

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.IAccountHandler.Search(System.String,System.Int32,Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.AccountSearchType)
member.summary: Executes a search against the account handler to find accounts matching the query string.
member.remarks: The search should match query string parts against substrings in the account information (non case sensitive). For example, the query string "bert do" would match "Robert Doe (rdoe@example.com) since "bert" is a substring of "Robert" and "do" is a substring of "Doe".
member.param: The query string to search for, each part is separated by whitespace.
The maximum number of entries that should be returned.
The type of accounts to return in the search
member.returns: The search results, or an empty array if no results were found.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.IAccountHandler.Id
member.summary: The unique identification of the account handler.
member.remarks: No other account handler should have the same ID.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.IAccountHandler.SupportsAsyncSearch
member.summary: If the account handler supports the method, it should return true here, otherwise, return false.

member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:TouchScan.Scanner.Icct.ShowWindowCommands.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:TouchScan.Scanner.Icct.ShowWindowCommands.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:TouchScan.Scanner.Icct.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMinNoActive
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:TouchScan.Scanner.Icct.ShowWindowCommands.ShowNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:TouchScan.Scanner.Icct.ShowWindowCommands.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:TouchScan.Scanner.Icct.ShowWindowCommands.ShowDefault

member.name: M:TouchScan.ScanDestinations.Share.NetworkBrowser.NetServerEnum(System.String,System.Int32,System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.UInt32,System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The NetServerEnum function lists all servers of the specified type that are visible in a domain. For example, an application can call NetServerEnum to list all domain controllers only or all SQL servers only. You can combine bit masks to list several types. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa370623(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: Reserved; must be NULL.
The information level of the data requested.

A pointer to the buffer that receives the data. The format of this data depends on the value of the level parameter. This buffer is allocated by the system and must be freed using the NetApiBufferFree function. Note that you must free the buffer even if the function fails with ERROR_MORE_DATA.

The preferred maximum length of returned data, in bytes. If you specify MAX_PREFERRED_LENGTH, the function allocates the amount of memory required for the data. If you specify another value in this parameter, it can restrict the number of bytes that the function returns. If the buffer size is insufficient to hold all entries, the function returns ERROR_MORE_DATA.
A pointer to a value that receives the count of elements actually enumerated.
A pointer to a value that receives the total number of visible servers and workstations on the network. Note that applications should consider this value only as a hint.
A value that filters the server entries to return from the enumeration. This parameter can be a combination of the following values defined in the Lmserver.h header file.

A pointer to a constant string that specifies the name of the domain for which a list of servers is to be returned. The domain name must be a NetBIOS domain name (for example, microsoft). The NetServerEnum function does not support DNS-style names (for example, microsoft.com). If this parameter is NULL, the primary domain is implied.
Reserved; must be set to zero.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value can be several error codes.

member.name: M:TouchScan.ScanDestinations.Share.NetworkBrowser.NetApiBufferFree(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The NetApiBufferFree function frees the memory that the NetApiBufferAllocate function allocates. Applications should also call NetApiBufferFree to free the memory that other network management functions use internally to return information. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa370304(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: A pointer to a buffer returned previously by another network management function or memory allocated by calling the NetApiBufferAllocate function.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code. For a list of error codes, see System Error Codes.

member.name: M:TouchScan.ScanDestinations.Share.NetworkBrowser.NetShareEnum(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32,System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about each shared resource on a server. You can also use the WNetEnumResource function to retrieve resource information. However, WNetEnumResource does not enumerate hidden shares or users connected to a share. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb525387(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: Pointer to a string that specifies the DNS or NetBIOS name of the remote server on which the function is to execute. If this parameter is NULL, the local computer is used.
Specifies the information level of the data.

Pointer to the buffer that receives the data. The format of this data depends on the value of the level parameter. This buffer is allocated by the system and must be freed using the NetApiBufferFree function. Note that you must free the buffer even if the function fails with ERROR_MORE_DATA.

Specifies the preferred maximum length of returned data, in bytes. If you specify MAX_PREFERRED_LENGTH, the function allocates the amount of memory required for the data. If you specify another value in this parameter, it can restrict the number of bytes that the function returns. If the buffer size is insufficient to hold all entries, the function returns ERROR_MORE_DATA.
Pointer to a value that receives the count of elements actually enumerated.
Pointer to a value that receives the total number of entries that could have been enumerated. Note that applications should consider this value only as a hint.

Pointer to a value that contains a resume handle which is used to continue an existing share search. The handle should be zero on the first call and left unchanged for subsequent calls. If resume_handle is NULL, then no resume handle is stored.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code. For a list of error codes, see System Error Codes.

member.summary: Pointer to a Unicode string specifying the name of a shared resource. Calls to the NetShareSetInfo function ignore this member.

member.summary: A combination of values that specify the type of share. Calls to the NetShareSetInfo function ignore this member.

member.name: F:TouchScan.ScanDestinations.Share.NetworkBrowser._SHARE_INFO_502.shi502_remark
member.summary: Pointer to a Unicode string specifying an optional comment about the shared resource.

member.name: F:TouchScan.ScanDestinations.Share.NetworkBrowser._SHARE_INFO_502.shi502_permissions
member.summary: Specifies a DWORD value that indicates the shared resource's permissions for servers running with share-level security. This member is ignored on a server running user-level security. This member can be any of the following values. Calls to the NetShareSetInfo function ignore this member. Note that Windows does not support share-level security.

member.name: F:TouchScan.ScanDestinations.Share.NetworkBrowser._SHARE_INFO_502.shi502_max_uses
member.summary: Specifies a DWORD value that indicates the maximum number of concurrent connections that the shared resource can accommodate. The number of connections is unlimited if the value specified in this member is –1.

member.name: F:TouchScan.ScanDestinations.Share.NetworkBrowser._SHARE_INFO_502.shi502_current_uses
member.summary: Specifies a DWORD value that indicates the number of current connections to the resource. Calls to the NetShareSetInfo function ignore this member.

member.name: F:TouchScan.ScanDestinations.Share.NetworkBrowser._SHARE_INFO_502.shi502_path
member.summary: Pointer to a Unicode string that contains the local path for the shared resource. For disks, this member is the path being shared. For print queues, this member is the name of the print queue being shared. Calls to the NetShareSetInfo function ignore this member.

member.name: F:TouchScan.ScanDestinations.Share.NetworkBrowser._SHARE_INFO_502.shi502_passwd
member.summary: Pointer to a Unicode string that specifies the share's password (when the server is running with share-level security). If the server is running with user-level security, this member is ignored. Note that Windows does not support share-level security. This member can be no longer than SHPWLEN+1 bytes (including a terminating null character). Calls to the NetShareSetInfo function ignore this member.

member.name: F:TouchScan.ScanDestinations.Share.NetworkBrowser._SHARE_INFO_502.shi502_reserved
member.summary: Reserved; must be zero. Calls to the NetShareSetInfo function ignore this member.

member.name: F:TouchScan.ScanDestinations.Share.NetworkBrowser._SHARE_INFO_502.shi502_security_descriptor
member.summary: Specifies the SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR associated with this share.

member.name: T:TouchScan.Security.SslCertificateValidator
member.summary: Validates any TLS/SSL connections that the software is doing with remote servers.
member.remarks:
Is able to check for the following:
Certificate chain terminates with a known certificate for that domain.
The server domain name matches that of the certificate.

member.name: T:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner
member.summary: The IScanner interface is the main means of interacting with the scanner.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner.StartScanning(Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanHandler)
member.summary: Request the scanner to begin scanning the documents in the ADF or flatbed.
member.remarks: If the scan configuration is set to use ADF and there are no pages are in the scanner, a is thrown with an error. Check if there are pages in the scanner via method. Note that there could be paper in the flatbed, check the for the . Once scanning starts, you may cancel scanning at any time by calling . Another way to cancel scanning immediately after a page is by setting to true. The method can determine if there's a scan operation currently active. Each time a page has been scanned, the method is invoked on the given , with the page information. Once there are no more pages in the scanner, the method is invoked with the number of pages that were scanned. If an error occurrs during scanning for whatever reason, the method is invoked.
member.param: The scan handler to receive scan events such as page scanned, scan error, or scan finish. Cannot be null.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner.ContinueScanning(Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanHandler)
member.summary: Exactly identical to , except the page counter will not be reset to 1.
member.remarks: This only effects the page number and total page count which is returned by the and callbacks, which is offset by the current number of pages that were scanned successfully.
member.param: The scan handler to receive events. Cannot be null

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner.StopScanning
member.summary: Stops current scanning operation, and then completes the scanning with the pages that were scanned so far.
member.remarks: An exception is thrown if no scan operation is currently active, check if there's a scan operation via method.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner.CancelScanning
member.summary: Cancel current scanning operation, discarding any pages that were scanned and raising an error in the callback.
member.remarks: An exception is thrown if no scan operation is currently active, check if there's a scan operation via method.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner.IsScanning
member.summary: Returns true if there's a scan operation active, returns false otherwise.
member.returns: True if a scan operation is currently active, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner.HasPaperInTray
member.summary: Returns true if there's a paper in the scanner's ADF, returns false otherwise.
member.returns: True if the scanner's ADF has paper, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.IScanner.GetWarning
member.summary: Returns a warning status string, indicating a potential problem in the scanner.
member.remarks: If the scanner is operating normally, then null is returned. A warning is returned if a scanning operation may fail or execute abnormally.
member.returns: Scanner warning string,

member.name: T:TouchScan.Standard_Handlers.Builtin.BuiltinAuthenticationHandler
member.summary: Handles all operations on the built-in accounts.

member.name: T:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Authentication.IAuthenticationHandler
member.summary: Authentication handler can control which users can access the scanner.
member.remarks: When a user attempts to access the scanner, they must login first, if one of the authentication plugins confirms the login, the user is permitted access to the interface. Only enabled authentication handlers are proceessed, the IT administrator can configure which handlers are enabled based on their value.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Authentication.IAuthenticationHandler.LogOn(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Authenticates the given user and password against the authentication handler.
member.remarks: At the very least, the returned should have its username field set to the username argument given in this method. Other fields such as CommonName, Email, etc. are optional.
member.param: The username
The password
member.returns: An object representing the user account if authentication succeeded, null if username or password is incorrect.
member.exception: Thrown if authentication failed for other reason than incorrect password (server unreachable, etc).

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Authentication.IAuthenticationHandler.LogOff(Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.AccountEntry)
member.summary: Logs out the given user.
member.remarks: Note that this method may never get called. Handlers are expected to have expiration timers on the server side to automatically logout users once a certain period of time has expired.
member.param: The user account to log out

member.remarks: The ID is displayed to the IT administrator in the configuration console to choose which handlers are enabled.

member.summary:
Modifies an account entry provided the previous account and the account to takes the previous account's place.
NOTE: If the previousAccount is currently logged in, then the modification will not be immediate. The changes will not be put fully into place until the modifed user has logged out. The previous account being modified. The account that is taking the previous account's place.

member.name: T:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig
member.summary: Defines a scanning configuration.
member.remarks: This is a mutable class. Plugins can modify the scanning configuration by using . Please see the Panasonic Image Enhancement (PIE) documentation regarding various scanning features. Only minimal documentation is provided here.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.LoadDefaults
member.summary: Initializes default settings.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.ScannerModel
member.summary: The scanner model for which this scan config was initialized with.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.ScannerFeatures
member.summary: The scanner features for which this scan config was initialized with.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.ScanInfo
member.summary: Scanning info parameters.
member.remarks: This represents the [SCANINFO] section in the INI file.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.FileInfo
member.summary: Scanning file parameters.
member.remarks: This represents the [FILEINFO] section in the INI file.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.ScanCfg
member.summary: Scanning config parameters
member.remarks: This represents the [SCANNING -100] section in the INI file.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.InitialCounter
member.summary: Value of the initial counter. Default: 1.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.IsReferencePlateBlack
member.summary: Used internally to filter certain settings.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.HighResPreview
member.summary: Set to true, so that a high resolution preview is produced when getting the BitmapSource object from the ScanPageEventArgs. If set to false, then a low resolution thumbnail will be produced instead.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.PagesToScan
member.summary: The number of pages to be scanned (ADF only)
member.remarks: Set to -1 to scan all pages in the ADF, otherwise set to the number of pages to scan. Value must be between 1 and 254, or -1 to scan all pages.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.ImageFormat
member.summary: Sets the image format in which the documents are scanned as.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.JpegQuality
member.summary: The quality of JPEG images when is either or is used.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.PaperSize
member.summary: This function specifies the page size of the documents to be scanned. Since the sizes in which documents can be scanned differ depending on the scanner model used, refer to the scanner's instruction manuals.
member.remarks: This function may not work properly when documents are scanned by the scanner if the scanning mode is Color or Grayscale, and the document length is longer than 1270 mm (50 inches).

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.PaperLayout
member.summary: Specify the direction of paper.
member.remarks: This function is disabled if is set to .

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.Resolution
member.summary: This function specifies the resolution (dots per inch) for scanning.
member.remarks: Dots per inch (dpi) are used as the resolution unit, and 200 dpi are equivalent to about 8 pixels per millimeter. When the resolution is increased, the image becomes clearer but proportionately more memory, disk space, and processing time are required.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.PaperSource
member.summary: This function sets the paper side or sides to be scanned. If the scanner comes with a flatbed, can also be selected.
member.remarks: For AutoSimplex and AutoDuplex, if there is a document in the ADF, scanning will be performed from the ADF. If there is no document in the ADF, scanning will be performed from the Flatbed. To check if scanner includes a flatbed, check the for the . AutoSimplex and AutoDuplex cannot be used if is set to .

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.ColorFormat
member.summary: This function selects the scanning mode: The mode yielding black and white data, the mode yielding data in 256 levels, and the mode yielding color data.
member.remarks:
The Color mode and grayscale mode enable photos and other images with halftones to be scanned at a high level of quality but a large memory and a lengthy scanning time are required. (If images with halftones are to be captured in the Monochrome mode, refer to .)
In the Automatic mode, whether the document is monochrome or color is identified automatically: with black and white pages, the pages are scanned in the Monochrome mode, and with color pages, they are scanned in the Color mode.
The scanning speed drops when the Automatic mode is used.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.HalftoneMode
member.summary: Halftone (dither) is a technique for reproducing images with halftones such as photos in the Monochrome mode. By using it in this mode, photo images can be scanned faster and with less memory than in the grayscale mode.
member.remarks: Halftone (dither) cannot be used at the same time as Automatic Crop, Deskew, Dynamic Threshold, or Noise Reduction.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.FitToPage
member.summary: The Fit To Page mode scans the image in a range slightly larger than the specified scanning area, and reduces it so that it has the same dimensions as the scanning area.
member.remarks: Normally, the scanner scans an area which is 100% of the actual page size. When this is the case, depending on whether the paper is skewed and how the sheets are stacked, the paper may shift out of the scanning range so that some places along the edges of the image may be missing. When the Fit To Page mode is used, the image produced by scanning is slightly smaller than the actual size, but the whole image will be scanned right down to the edges without missing any places.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.RemoveShadow
member.summary: This function removes the shadows cast by the paper itself at its top, bottom, left, and right edges. When it is used, about 3 mm along the edges of the paper are forcibly turned white.
member.remarks: This feature cannot be used in long paper mode.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.RemoveHoles
member.summary: This feature removes artifacts from scanned images that are caused by holes punched in the edges of scanned documents.
member.remarks: Round or square black shapes around the edges are replaced with the color closest to the color of the document. This feature detects hole punch artifacts that are between 1 to 25.4 mm from each edge of the scanned document. Rectangular and round artifacts that are between 4 to 12 mm wide can be detected. This feature may not perform as expected if holes are made in areas of the scanned document containing text or pictures.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.ImageEmphasis
member.summary: This function adjusts the image emphasis.
member.remarks:
One of five level settings—, , , , and —can be selected. When the Smooth setting is selected, the image becomes softer, and noise (black spots) generation is minimized. Conversely, when the High setting is selected, the images become crisper, and details such as narrow lines become sharper. Medium serves as the default setting.
Image Emphasis cannot be set if the Automatic Brightness is used.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.RemoveNoise
member.summary: This function reduces the black or white spots (noise) which appear in scanned images.
member.remarks: If there is a large amount of noise in the scanned images, the size of the file concerned after compression may be increased and/or the OCR recognition rate decreased. There are seven Noise Reduction settings: Off, 1x1 matrix, 2x2 matrix, 3x3 matrix, 4x4 matrix, 5x5 matrix, and 6x6 matrix. The larger the matrix, the greater the amount of noise which can be reduced but punctuation marks (such as commas), and other text-related details may also become invisible. Noise Reduction can be used only when Monochrome has been selected as the ColorFormat.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.MoireReduction
member.summary: When magazines and other printed material or documents printed in color using a printer are scanned, moire (a wavy effect produced by superimposing different geometric patterns) sometimes appears in the images. Setting the Moire Reduction function to on reduces the moire effect.
member.remarks: The scanning speed decreases when the Moire Reduction function is selected.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.SmoothBackground
member.summary: This function detects the background color of documents when scanning, and increases image compression rate by using it as the reference.
member.remarks: The scanning speed decreases when this function is selected.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.RemoveBackground
member.summary: This feature detects the background color of the scanned image and replaces the background color with white.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.EC_WhiteLevelFromPaper
member.summary: This function produces a mirror image with the left of the scanned image appearing on the right and vice versa.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.WhiteLevelFromPaper
member.summary: This function uses white as reference when documents with color background are scanned.
member.remarks: Normally, when text written on paper with colored background such as red, blue, or some other color is scanned, the resulting image will have a great deal of noise. When the White Level From Paper function is used, the color background of the paper is ignored, and a clear image is obtained. White Level From Paper cannot be used at the same time as Automatic Crop, Deskew, or Margin. White Level From Paper cannot be used in Color or Automatic mode.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.DynamicThreshold
member.summary: The Dynamic Threshold mode function is a useful scanning means for documents with areas whose background is in color.
member.remarks: The Dynamic Threshold mode function is valid only in the Black and White mode. Settings such as Image Emphasis and Automatic Separation cannot be used. (Even if they can be set, the settings will be ignored.)

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.DynamicThresholdMode
member.summary: Controls the dynamic threshold mode.
member.remarks: DynamicThreshold must be enabled for this configuration to take effect.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.AutomaticSeparation
member.summary: This function enables the scanner to automatically differentiate between text areas and photo areas, and scan them accordingly. Text areas are scanned in the mode whereas photo areas are scanned using the specified Halftone (dither) pattern.
member.remarks: The Automatic Separation function is valid only in the mode. It cannot be used at the same time as Noise Reduction, Dynamic Threshold, Automatic Binary/Color Distinction, Automatic Crop, Deskew, or Automatic Image Orientation.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.ColorMatching
member.summary: This function provides color matching with other equipment.
member.remarks: "sRGB" is an international standard for correctly reproducing colors between computer displays, printers, and scanners. When is specified, the reproduction of the colors between the equipment is improved, but the number of colors which can be reproduced is lowered. This function is valid only for color images in the Color mode.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.DropOut
member.summary: This function scans documents while deleting the text and illustrations printed on documents in the specified colors of red, blue, and green.
member.remarks: It is used, for instance, to facilitate OCR processing by deleting the red frame around OCR forms. The function cannot be used in color mode.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.RemoveBorders
member.summary: This function removes the black borders, formed during scanning, or copying, from around the images.
member.remarks: If there are dark areas at the periphery of a document, these areas may be removed as well.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.AutomaticCrop
member.summary: This function automatically recognizes the image size and crops it.
member.remarks: When it is used to scan documents of different sizes continuously, the documents are scanned in the respective sizes and no memory is wasted. By using the Flatbed, you can scan multiple documents at once. The image size for each document is automatically detected and the images are cropped accordingly.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.Deskew
member.summary: This function corrects the skew in scanned images, restoring the images to the upright position.
member.remarks: This function cannot be used at the same time as Long Paper

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.LengthControl
member.summary: When the Length Control function is selected, the scanner scans the documents in the size that corresponds to their length.
member.remarks: If, for instance, Length Control is set to off when A4 and A5 width documents are to be scanned continuously, the documents with the A5 width will also be scanned in the A4 size, and the roller will be scanned for the parts corresponding to their bottom halves. Conversely, if Length Control is set to on, and some A4 documents and some A5 width documents are scanned in the same session, the A4 documents will be scanned in the A4 size, and the A5 width documents will be scanned in the A5 length size, and no memory will be wasted.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.LongPaper
member.summary: This function scans long documents.
member.remarks: The scanned images are split into the size specified by and filed. The document length which can be scanned varies according to the size of the memory installed inside the scanner. This function cannot be used at the same time as when documents are scanned using Automatic Crop, Deskew, Detect Double Feed, Control Sheet, or 2-Page Separation.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.Margin
member.summary: When Margin is selected, documents are scanned over a slightly larger area at their tops and bottoms than the size specified by .
member.remarks:
By setting Margin and Image Width which is a little wider than the actual width, the documents can be scanned without missing any parts of the document images even when the paper is skewed. The dimensions of the margin differ depending on the scanner.
The Margin function cannot be used at the same as when documents are scanned using White Level From Paper, Control Sheet, Separation Sheet, Patchcode, Automatic Crop, Deskew, or Flatbed.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.DoubleFeedMode
member.summary: This function detects the feeding of more than one sheet of the document at a time.
member.remarks: This function cannot be used at the same time as Detect Stapled Document.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.DoubleFeedSensor
member.summary: Specifies which sensors to use to detect double feed.
member.remarks: This is a bitmask of the enum.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.DoubleFeedAction
member.summary: Specifies the action to take when double feed has been detected.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.StapleDetectMode
member.summary: This function stops the scanning when documents are stapled together.
member.remarks: This function cannot be used at the same time as Skew Stop, Detect Double Feed, or Flatbed.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.StapleDetectEnhanced
member.summary: This setting will detect documents that are skewed, in addition to doubly fed or bent when using stable detection mode.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.StapleDetectSensor
member.summary: Specifies which sensors to use to detect stapled documents.
member.remarks: This is a bitmask of the enum.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.DetectControlSheet
member.summary: Use of control sheets enables the scanning conditions to be changed at any time while scanning is in progress.
member.remarks:
When control sheets are inserted between the sheets of the document to be scanned, the scanning conditions are changed starting with the document sheet that comes after each control sheet.
The Detect Control Sheet function cannot be used at the same time as Automatic Crop, Deskew, Margin, or Flatbed. When the function is used, the scanning speed decreases. The function cannot be used to scan paper in sizes smaller than A6. The control sheets cannot be used at the same time as the Blank Page Removal function.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.AutomaticImageOrientation
member.summary: This function detects the orientation of characters in the document and rotates the scanned image to the correct orientation in 90° increments.
member.remarks: This function cannot be used at the same time as Rotation, Duplex Type, or Automatic Separation.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.Rotation
member.summary: Set scanned image rotation.
member.remarks: Cannot be used with Automatic Image Orientation.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.DuplexType
member.summary: The direction of the images on the back sides of duplex scanned images is specified here.
member.remarks: This function is enabled only with duplex scanning. This function cannot be used at the same time as Automatic Image Orientation.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.DoubleExposureMode
member.summary: Enables double exposure mode.
member.remarks: When scanning in double exposure mode, the back side of a page is added alongside the front side of the page as a single image. The layout of this is configured through the double exposure mode.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.TwoPageSeparationMode
member.summary: Separate 1 page (image) into 2 pages in the specified order.
member.remarks: This function cannot be used at the same time as Double Exposure, Long Paper, Scanning Area, or Multi-Crop.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.RemoveBlankPages
member.summary: Skipping the scanning of pages with no text or images (perfectly white, perfectly black or plain) is specified here.
member.remarks: It enables you to scan a batch of documents that contain blank pages without wasting hard disk space by removing the blank pages. This function cannot be used with flatbed scanning.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.BlankPagePixelRatio
member.summary: To be used with . If blank pages are scanned, use the BlankPagePixelRatio to set the ratio to a higher value; conversely, if pages which are not blank are skipped, set it to a lower value.
member.remarks: Default value is 0.2%.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.AutomaticImageEmphasis
member.summary: This function automatically adjusts the image quality of the scanned images.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.EC_AutomaticBrightnessAdjustment
member.summary: Automatically adjusts the brightness of images.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.AutomaticBrightnessAdjustment
member.summary: Automatically adjust the brightness of scanned images.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.ScanConfig.DetectDogEar
member.summary: This function detects irregularities (e.g., dog-ears, vignetting) in a scanned document.

member.name: M:CyclicLogTraceListener.#ctor
member.summary: constructor contains defaults if values aren't specified

member.name: M:CyclicLogTraceListener.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: this method is used when trace configured via the system.diagnostics section of the .config file all the parameters are set via a single initializeData string in this format: "booleanValue=true, stringValue='string', longValue=567"

member.name: M:CyclicLogTraceListener.ParseBoolean(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: parses values of the form name=true, name=false

member.name: M:CyclicLogTraceListener.ParseLong(System.String,System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: parses values of the form name=3, name=28932

member.name: M:CyclicLogTraceListener.ParseString(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: parses values of the form name='data', name="data", name=data

member.name: M:CyclicLogTraceListener.CreateLogFileName(System.Int64)
member.summary: creates a new log filename in this format "Directory \ FileNameTemplate"

member.name: M:CyclicLogTraceListener.EnforceFileThreshold
member.summary: Check that no more than (n) log files will exist at any given time; if more than (n) do exist, the oldest one is deleted

member.name: M:CyclicLogTraceListener.OpenLogFile(System.Int64)
member.summary: Opens the "current" log file; this can be either an existing incomplete log file or a brand new log file

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.AutoFlush
member.summary: If true, log file is flushed after every write. Can also be set via trace="autoflush" in the system.diagnostics .config file section

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.FolderName
member.summary: Folder that log files will be written to. Defaults to current folder.

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.FieldSeparator
member.summary: Seperator used between log field entries. Defaults to comma.

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.FileNameTemplate
member.summary: Template used to generate log filenames supports standard String.Format for two values: file index {0:} and current date {1:} using the standard String.Format conventions Defaults to "{0:0000}.log"

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.AddMethod
member.summary: Add the method name of the calling function to the log. Defaults to True.

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.AddPidTid
member.summary: Add the process and thread ID to the log. Defaults to False.

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.TimeStampFormat
member.summary: If a format string is provided, the time will be added to each log entry. Defaults to "yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss". Set to empty string to disable.

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.FileCountThreshold
member.summary: Maximum number of log files to create. Defaults to 10000.

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.FileAgeThreshold
member.summary: Maximum age, in FileAgeUnits, of log files before a new log file will be created Defaults to 0, infinite

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.FileAgeUnit
member.summary: Determines what time unit is represented in FileAgeThreshold. Defaults to AgeUnit.Days

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.FileSizeThreshold
member.summary: Maximum file size each log is allowed to grow to before a new log is created. Defaults to 512kb.

member.name: P:CyclicLogTraceListener.FileSizeUnit
member.summary: Determines what size unit is represented in FileSizeThreshold. Defaults to Bytes.

member.name: T:CyclicLogTraceListener.AgeUnit
member.summary: Indicates what unit of time FileAgeThreshold represents

member.name: T:CyclicLogTraceListener.SizeUnit
member.summary: Indicates what unit of size FileBytesThreshold represents

member.name: T:TouchScan.Util.PowerScheme
member.summary:
The windows concept of a power scheme to manage power options such as display dimming, idle timeouts, display brightness, and CPU throtting. PowerScheme class represents these options.
NOTE: This class only supports Windows Vista and higher. This class will not work properly on a XP machine.

member.summary: Default constructor of a Windows power scheme provided its coorisponding GUID.
member.param: The GUID id for the power scheme.

member.summary: Commit any changes to the power scheme by setting active power scheme to this instance.

member.summary: Set the sleep timeout when the device is using battery.
member.param: The sleep timeout in minutes.

member.summary: Set the sleep timeout when the device is plugged into a power supply.
member.param: The sleep timeout in minutes.

member.summary: Gets the friendly name of this power scheme.
member.returns: The friendly name.

member.summary: Sets the friendly name of this power scheme.
member.param: The friendly name for this power scheme.

member.name: M:TouchScan.Util.PowerScheme.GetPluggedInSleepTimeout
member.summary: Gets the sleep timeout (in minutes) for this power scheme when a power supply is plugged in.
member.returns: The sleep timeout in minutes

member.name: M:TouchScan.Util.PowerScheme.PowerReadFriendlyName(System.IntPtr,System.Guid@,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the friendly name for the specified power setting, subgroup, or scheme. If the SchemeGuid parameter is not NULL but both the SubGroupOfPowerSettingsGuid and PowerSettingGuid parameters are NULL, the friendly name of the power scheme will be returned. If the SchemeGuid and SubGroupOfPowerSettingsGuid parameters are not NULLand the PowerSettingGuid parameter is NULL, the friendly name of the subgroup will be returned. If the SchemeGuid, SubGroupOfPowerSettingsGuid, and PowerSettingGuid parameters are not NULL, the friendly name of the power setting will be returned. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa372740(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: This parameter is reserved for future use and must be set to NULL.
The identifier of the power scheme.
The subgroup of power settings. Use NO_SUBGROUP_GUID to refer to the default power scheme.
The identifier of the power setting that is being used.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the friendly name. If this parameter is NULL, the BufferSize parameter receives the required buffer size. The strings returned are all wide (Unicode) strings.

A pointer to a variable that contains the size of the buffer pointed to by the Buffer parameter. If the Buffer parameter is NULL, the function returns ERROR_SUCCESS and the variable receives the required buffer size. If the specified buffer size is not large enough to hold the requested data, the function returns ERROR_MORE_DATA and the variable receives the required buffer size.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS (zero) if the call was successful, and a nonzero value if the call failed. If the buffer size specified by the BufferSize parameter is too small, ERROR_MORE_DATA will be returned and the DWORD pointed to by the BufferSize parameter will be filled in with the required buffer size.

member.name: M:TouchScan.Util.PowerScheme.PowerWriteFriendlyName(System.IntPtr,System.Guid@,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the friendly name for the specified power setting, subgroup, or scheme. If the SchemeGuid parameter is not NULL but both the SubGroupOfPowerSettingsGuid and PowerSettingGuid parameters are NULL, the friendly name of the power scheme will be set. If the SchemeGuid and SubGroupOfPowerSettingsGuid parameters are not NULLand the PowerSettingGuid parameter is NULL, the friendly name of the subgroup will be set. If the SchemeGuid, SubGroupOfPowerSettingsGuid, and PowerSettingGuid parameters are not NULL, the friendly name of the power setting will be set. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa372773(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: This parameter is reserved for future use and must be set to NULL.
The identifier of the power scheme.
The subgroup of power settings. This parameter can be one of the following values defined in WinNT.h. Use NO_SUBGROUP_GUID to refer to the default power scheme.
The identifier of the power setting.
The friendly name, in wide (Unicode) characters.
The size of the friendly name specified by the Buffer parameter, including the terminating NULL character.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS (zero) if the call was successful, and a nonzero value if the call failed.

member.summary: Retrieves the AC index of the specified power setting. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa372735(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: This parameter is reserved for future use and must be set to NULL.

The subgroup of power settings. This parameter can be one of the following values defined in WinNT.h. Use NO_SUBGROUP_GUID to refer to the default power scheme.
The identifier of the power setting.
A pointer to a variable that receives the AC value index.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS (zero) if the call was successful, and a nonzero value if the call failed.

member.name: M:TouchScan.Util.PowerSchemeUtil.PowerEnumerate(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Guid@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Enumerates the specified elements in a power scheme. This function is normally called in a loop incrementing the Index parameter to retrieve subkeys until they've all been enumerated. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa372730(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: This parameter is reserved for future use and must be set to NULL
The identifier of the power scheme. If this parameter is NULL, an enumeration of the power policies is returned
The subgroup of power settings. If this parameter is NULL, an enumeration of settings under the PolicyGuid key is returned
A set of flags that specifies what will be enumerated
The zero-based index of the scheme, subgroup, or setting that is being enumerated
A pointer to a variable to receive the elements. If this parameter is NULL, the function retrieves the size of the buffer required

A pointer to a variable that on input contains the size of the buffer pointed to by the Buffer parameter. If the Buffer parameter is NULL or if the BufferSize is not large enough, the function will return ERROR_MORE_DATA and the variable receives the required buffer size
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS (zero) if the call was successful, and a non-zero value if the call failed. If the buffer size passed in the BufferSize parameter is too small, or if the Buffer parameter is NULL, ERROR_MORE_DATA will be returned and the DWORD pointed to by the BufferSize parameter will be filled in with the required buffer size.

member.name: M:TouchScan.Util.PowerSchemeUtil.PowerDuplicateScheme(System.IntPtr,System.Guid@,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Duplicates a power scheme so that it can be modified. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa372729(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: This parameter is reserved for future use and must be set to NULL.
The identifier of the power scheme that is to be duplicated.

The address of a poiter to a GUID. If the pointer contains NULL, the function allocates memory for a new GUID and puts the address of this memory in the pointer. The caller can free this memory using LocalFree.

member.summary: Unregisters an account handler.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.AccountManager.SearchAsync(System.String,Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.ISearchResultReceiver,System.Int32,System.Int32,Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.AccountSearchType)
member.summary: Search the account asynchronously.

A search result callback.
The max number of entries to return.

The type of accounts to search for

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.AccountManager.Search(System.String,System.Int32,Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.AccountSearchType)
member.summary: Executes a search against all currently registered and enabled account handlers.
member.remarks: This executes a search for all registered and enabled account handlers, and aggregates the results into a single array of account entries. The search is executed in the order that account handlers were registered, once the maxEntries number of entries is reached, the search is terminated.
member.param: The query string. See on what this parameter means
The maximum number of entries that should be present in the array
The type of accounts to search for
member.returns: The aggregated search results from all account handlers

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.AccountManager.LoggedInAccount
member.summary: The currently logged in account.
member.remarks: This is set automatically after a successful login by using the object returned in the authentication handler method. It is set back to null when the user logs out, or when the logout timer expires.

member.name: T:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Authentication.AuthenticationManager
member.summary: The AuthenticationManager is used to manage the login to the KV-SS1100 user interface.
member.remarks:
Plugins can register authentication handlers that will have their method called when a login is requested to the KV-SS1100 interface. Once a successful login has been found with one of the handlers, the account entry shall be set on the .
Only enabled authentication handlers are By default, the built-in authentication handler will accept the "admin" and "guest" logins

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Authentication.AuthenticationManager.RegisterAuthenticationHandler(Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Authentication.IAuthenticationHandler)
member.summary: Register a new authentication handler to handle logins.
member.remarks: The admin chooses which authentication handlers are used for login based on their value. Only enabled authentication handlers will be used for login.
member.param: The handler to register

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Authentication.AuthenticationManager.UnregisterAuthenticationHandler(Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Authentication.IAuthenticationHandler)
member.summary: Unregister an authentication handler.
member.remarks: Once a handler is unregistered, it is no longer used for login.
member.param: The handler to unregister

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Authentication.AuthenticationManager.LogOff(Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Account.AccountEntry)
member.summary: Logs off the given account.
member.remarks: The log off operation occurs against the account's authentication handler. If the account does not have an authentication handler, then this method does nothing.
member.param: The account to log off

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Authentication.AuthenticationManager.LogOn(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to login using the given username and password against currently registered and enabled authentication handlers.
member.remarks: A login is attempted against each currently registered and enabled handler by using the method. After one of the handlers returns a successful login, the returned object is returned from this call and the authentication process completes.
member.param: The username
The password
member.returns: If login is successful, the AccountEntry beloning to that account is returned, if the login is not successful (bad username or password), null is returned.
member.exception: If authentication has failed for other reason (unreachable server, other unexpected error).

member.name: T:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.PageScanEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments for a page scan event. Each scan event represents a document scanned from the scanner API.
member.remarks: The event args includes metadata information about the document, such as if its the back page or its page number.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.PageScanEventArgs.OpenStream
member.summary: Retrieves the file data as a stream.
member.remarks: The stream remains valid even after the callback method has finished execution.
member.returns: A stream containing the scanned page file data. Only one stream may be opened per scanned page.

member.name: M:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.PageScanEventArgs.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose scan page event args. Automatically called after it has been processed.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.PageScanEventArgs.PageImage
member.summary: The scanned page as a BitmapImage.
member.remarks: The format and resolution of the bitmap depends on the parameters given in the that was specified on the scanner object. This can be used to put the image of the scanned page in the UI.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.PageScanEventArgs.PageNumber
member.summary: Returns the page number since the start of a scan session.
member.remarks: When a scan session is started via the page number is reset to zero. For every following page, the page number is incremented until the end of the scan session, when there is no more paper in the ADF.

member.name: P:Panasonic.KV_SS1100.API.Scanner.PageScanEventArgs.FileDataBytes
member.summary: Retrieves the file data as bytes.

member.name: F:TouchScan.Util.MapVirtualKeyMapTypes.MAPVK_VK_TO_VSC
member.summary: uCode is a virtual-key code and is translated into a scan code. If it is a virtual-key code that does not distinguish between left- and right-hand keys, the left-hand scan code is returned. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:TouchScan.Util.MapVirtualKeyMapTypes.MAPVK_VSC_TO_VK
member.summary: uCode is a scan code and is translated into a virtual-key code that does not distinguish between left- and right-hand keys. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:TouchScan.Util.MapVirtualKeyMapTypes.MAPVK_VK_TO_CHAR
member.summary: uCode is a virtual-key code and is translated into an unshifted character value in the low-order word of the return value. Dead keys (diacritics) are indicated by setting the top bit of the return value. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:TouchScan.Util.MapVirtualKeyMapTypes.MAPVK_VSC_TO_VK_EX
member.summary: Windows NT/2000/XP: uCode is a scan code and is translated into a virtual-key code that distinguishes between left- and right-hand keys. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.summary: Escapes an object name so that it is a valid filename.
member.param: Original object name.
member.returns: Escaped name.
member.remarks: All characters that are not valid for a filename, plus "%" and ".", are converted into "%uuuu", where uuuu is the hexadecimal unicode representation of the character.
